text:
I'm also using Manjaro! (Been loving it for the past 6 months, my first linux distro I'm actually using long term)

Here's what I think I installed from pamac/pacman on Manjaro (following <https://wiki.archlinux.org/index.php/TeX_Live#Installation>)
• texlive-most
• texlive-lang
• biber
Then I use VSCode (well, I actually use the open source release Code - OSS thats in pamac/pacman), with the LaTeX Workshop extension by James Yu (<https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=James-Yu.latex-workshop>). Really nice to use, autocompletion, nice highlighing, and button for building pdfs and cleaning aux files.

Overall, best experience with LaTeX I've ever had. Moved away from Overleaf. Never had to install any packages because I think `texlive-most` and `texlive-lang` preinstalls most of it I think? Maybe I also don't use packages that might be obscure.

yep I have exactly the same latex setup as <@U0138UTB7A4>, except on Arch instead of manjaro

<@U7JQGPGCQ> I used to use MikTex and didn't notice much difference except that yeah,  there is no live downloading. If you run into a package that you don't have installed, it's almost always in another AUR package called `texlive-____` . I just google the name of the package + arch linux or something.

If you find one that isn't packaged in the AUR... well I'm not sure what to do there. It hasn't happened yet. I imagine it is not fun though.
